pr_title: [FLINK-19942][Connectors / JDBC]Support sink parallelism configuration to JDBC connector

timeline.bodyText: does the equals and hash function need to be modify? @zhuxiaoshang
timeline.author: zhisheng17
V1ncentzzZ

replies.bodyText:
Maybe the framework will check whether the parallelism > max parallelism limit.
Moreover where do you get the 128?IIRC,128 is the limit of max keyGroup.
replies.author: zhuxiaoshang

replies.bodyText: My suggestion is that use equals() instead of == beacause of the == will return false when parallelism's value more than 128.
replies.author: V1ncentzzZ

timeline.bodyText: @zhuxiaoshang maybe, idea will recommend to use equals() instead of ==
timeline.author: zhisheng17

timeline.bodyText:
It's seem this method is useless now? If no one uses it, please delete it. Otherwise, we can just treat this method as
of(outputFormat, null)
timeline.author: fsk119

@@ -36,6 +38,23 @@ static OutputFormatProvider of(OutputFormat<RowData> outputFormat) {

timeline.message: [FLINK-19942][Connectors / JDBC]Support sink parallelism configuration to JDBC connector

timeline.bodyText: This is a public API. Please add a new method instead of changing the existing one, otherwise, it's not API compatible.
timeline.author: wuchong

replies.bodyText:
According to  @fsk119 's suggestion,I removed the old method because it is never used.
If not i can get it back.
replies.author: zhuxiaoshang

replies.bodyText: This is a public API. We don't know whether it is used by external projects.
replies.author: wuchong

timeline.bodyText:
I'm not sure about adding this to JdbcExecutionOptions, because JdbcExecutionOptions is an public API for JdbcSink. For JdbcSink#sink, this may looks weird because the configured parallelism doesn't work as the returned object is SinkFunction.
Another option is adding the parallelism to JdbcDmlOption or JdbcOption, they are both internal class.
timeline.author: wuchong

timeline.message:
[FLINK-19942][jdbc] Support sink parallelism configuration for JDBC connector

This closes #13907
